dialogueTree.title: Colonial Mug Collection: "A row of mugs sits on the shelf. Ea..."
dialogueTree.text: A row of mugs sits on the shelf. Each one depicts a human figure: a dark-skinned woman grinning amidst mysterious symbols, a broad-shouldered man shovelling potatoes, and others.

links.title: You: "Tap on the mugs."
links.text: Tap on the mugs.

links.title: Colonial Mug Collection: "A little ring. Though cheerful, the..."
links.text: A little ring. Though cheerful, the images on the ceramic make you vaguely uncomfortable.

links.title: Conceptualization: "There's something disdainful in the..."
links.text: There's something disdainful in the way the curves and lines of the bodies were drawn.

links.title: Empathy: "The images betray a lack of interes..."
links.text: The images betray a lack of interest in human beings. They are merely unflattering caricatures.

links.title: You: "What do I mean *uncomfortable*?"
links.text: What do I mean *uncomfortable*?

links.title: Empathy: "The owner of these mugs doesn't lik..."
links.text: The owner of these mugs doesn't like people of other ethnicities very much.

links.title: You: "Typical asshole."
links.text: Typical asshole.

links.title: Empathy: "This person is unhappy."
links.text: This person is unhappy.

links.title: You: "So what? They can think what they w..."
links.text: So what? They can think what they want. This is a free world.

links.title: Empathy: "Of course. So very free."
links.text: Of course. So very free.

links.title: Rhetoric: "And so *fun*."
links.text: And so *fun*.

links.title: You: "Thanks, good to know. I have no opi..."
links.text: Thanks, good to know. I have no opinion on this.

links.title: Empathy: "Anytime."
links.text: Anytime.

links.title: Conceptualization: "It looks like the artist is celebra..."
links.text: It looks like the artist is celebrating diversity, but underneath he's just making fun of these people.

links.title: You: "Cynical slippery bastard."
links.text: Cynical slippery bastard.

links.title: Conceptualization: "You ain't gonna change someone's mi..."
links.text: You ain't gonna change someone's mind by calling them a bastard.

links.title: You: "I don't see these as stereotypes. I..."
links.text: I don't see these as stereotypes. I think they are honest acknowledgements of difference.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Of course... You slippery bastard."
links.text: Of course... You slippery bastard.

links.title: You: "I don't think I like the owner of t..."
links.text: I don't think I like the owner of this apartment.

links.title: Conceptualization: "No one's telling you to like him. Y..."
links.text: No one's telling you to like him. You might learn something from him, though.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant picks up one of the..."
links.text: The lieutenant picks up one of the mugs, then puts it back down with a look of disdain.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm beginning to feel better about..."
links.text: "I'm beginning to feel better about breaking into this man's apartment."

links.title: You: "Whip out your Yellow Man mug and co..."
links.text: Whip out your Yellow Man mug and compare.

links.title: Colonial Mug Collection: "Yes, your broken mug friend would f..."
links.text: Yes, your broken mug friend would feel very much at home here. The same humour, the same mocking lines...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's the missing tin soldier,"..."
links.text: "There's the missing tin soldier," the lieutenant looks at the mugs next to each other. "Whoever lives here might have used the Whirling's container to dump his trash..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And now they've drawn the ire of t..."
links.text: "And now they've drawn the ire of the Union. The plot thickens, as they say."

links.title: Logic: "The owner of this collection could..."
links.text: The owner of this collection could be dumping his trash in the Whirling's container.

links.title: Logic: "An interesting little clue. Let's s..."
links.text: An interesting little clue. Let's see where this goes. Clues have a way of magically connecting to other clues -- down the road.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Perhaps you should break into apart..."
links.text: Perhaps you should break into apartments more often?

links.title: You: "Recall the Yellow Man mug you found..."
links.text: Recall the Yellow Man mug you found in the Whirling trash container.

links.title: Colonial Mug Collection: "Yes, your broken mug friend would h..."
links.text: Yes, your broken mug friend would have felt very much at home here.

links.title: You: ""Do you really think it's the same..."
links.text: "Do you really think it's the same person who put the dead man's clothes in the trash?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Who knows?" The lieutenant opens h..."
links.text: "Who knows?" The lieutenant opens his notebook. "I'm not expecting too much from this *clothes in the trash* lead either way. It might turn out to be some random local matter. But still -- a nice coincidence."

links.title: Logic: "You could ask Evrart who this perso..."
links.text: You could ask Evrart who this person is? Once you're done here...

links.title: Logic: "Who knows? Could be, but this 'clot..."
links.text: Who knows? Could be, but this 'clothes in the trash' lead doesn't really seem like it's going anywhere. Still, good thing to keep in mind.

links.title: You: "Move on from the mugs. [Leave.]"
links.text: Move on from the mugs. [Leave.]
